    {
      "title": "Insecure JWT Handling",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-352",

      "recommendation": "Ensure that the JWT is signed using a secure algorithm and validate the token on each request. Consider using a library that handles JWT securely."

      "title": "Potential Information Disclosure",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-209",
      "description": "The application provides a generic error message for invalid credentials, which could allow attackers to infer valid usernames.",
      "line_numbers": [30, 50],
      "recommendation": "Implement more generic error messages that do not disclose whether the username or password was incorrect."
    },
    {
      "title": "Session Fixation Vulnerability",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-384",
      "description": "The application does not invalidate the previous session upon successful login, which could allow an attacker to hijack a session.",
      "line_numbers": [36, 42],
      "recommendation": "Invalidate the previous session and create a new session upon successful authentication to prevent session fixation attacks."
    },
    {
      "title": "Lack of Rate Limiting on Login Attempts",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-307",
      "description": "The application does not implement rate limiting on login attempts, making it susceptible to brute force attacks.",
      "line_numbers": [25],
      "recommendation": "Implement rate limiting on login attempts to mitigate brute force attacks, such as locking the account after a certain number of failed attempts."
    }
  ]
}
